tn.text: Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so except where noted, the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: command you today ... you will pass
tn.text: Moses is speaking to the Israelites as a group, so both instances of the word "you" are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Here "I" refers to Moses. The elders are there in agreement with Moses, but he is the only one speaking.

Plaster is usually a mixture of lime, sand, and water that is spread on something. It dries to form a hard, smooth surface on which a person can write. AT: "spread plaster on them" or "make them so you can write on them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: a land flowing with milk and honey
tn.text: This is an idiom. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:06:03|6:3]]. AT: "a land where plenty of milk and honey flow" or "a land that is excellent for cattle and farming" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: you have passed ... set up ... I am commanding you
tn.text: Moses is addressing the Israelites as a group, so the instances of "you" and the command "set up" are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"spread plaster on them" or "make them so you can write on them." Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:27:01|27:2]].
This is a mountain near Shechem. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:11:29|11:29]].

tn.ref: you must raise no iron tool to work the stones
tn.text: This refers to the chisels that would make the stones smoother, in order that they might fit together better. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit.  AT: "you will not shape the altar stones with iron tools" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
stones in their natural shape that no one has shaped with metal tools
This refers to the stones they were to set up on Mount Ebal and cover with plaster. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:27:01|27:2]] and [[:en:bible:notes:deu:27:04|27:4]])
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if they were one man, so the words "you" and "your" here are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: obey the voice of Yahweh your God
tn.text: Here the metonym "voice of Yahweh" refers to what he says. AT: "obey what Yahweh your God says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses is commanding. The Levites are there in agreement with Moses, but he is the only one speaking.

Here the metonym "tribes" refers to the people from the tribes of Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Joseph, and Benjamin. AT: "The people from these tribes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
A small mountain north of Mount Ebal. Translate as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:11:29|11:29]].
This combines the tribes of Ephraim and Manasseh, who were descendants of Joseph.
Translate this as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:11:29|11:29]].
"say in a loud voice how Yahweh will curse Israel"

tn.ref: May the man be cursed ... sets it up in secret
tn.text: This is the statement the Levites must shout to all the people of Israel. It may be stated in active form. AT: "May Yahweh curse the person ... sets it up in secret" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the work of the hands of a craftsman
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "something a man has made" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
a man who knows how to make things well
Moses continues telling the Levites and the people what they must say.
This may be stated in active form. AT: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The full meaning of the statement can be made explicit. AT: "who takes land away from his neighbor by moving the markers on the borders of his land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Moses continues telling the Levites and the people what they must say.
This may be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:27:16|27:16]]. AT: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: uses force to take away the justice due to a foreigner ... widow
tn.text: Moses speaks of justice as if it were a physical object that a stronger person can violently pull away from a weaker person. Your language might have one word that means "use force to take away." Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:24:17|24:17]]. AT: "treats a foreigner ... widow unfairly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
These are children whose parents have both died and do not have relatives to care for them.
This means a woman whose husband has died and has no children to care for her in her old age.
Moses continues telling the Levites and the people what they must say.
This can be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:27:16|27:16]]. AT: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This does not refer to the man's mother, but another wife of his father.

tn.ref: he has taken away his father's rights
tn.text: When a man marries a woman, only he has the legal right to sleep with her. The full meaning of this statement may be made explicit. AT: "he has taken away his father's legal rights" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: who sleeps with any kind of beast
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "who sleeps with any kind of beast in the way that man sleeps with a woman" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the daughter of his father, or with the daughter of his mother
tn.text: This means a man cannot sleep with his sister, even if she has a different mother or father.
